page.title: 04MARINE & GENERAL ENGINEERING
page.content: Marine & General's main job is repairing boats and engines,but some times they{build boats}such as the 65 foot Herm Trident 1V.The firm has been going since 1950,and they{employ}65 men.The men there make their own bolts and beam rollers.Inside the workshop they carry out welding,oiling and drilling.They have their own slipway at the{harbour}which takes 10 men to alter according to the size of the boat.The slipway can take a boat up to 650 tons or 240 feet by 40 feet.The boat is floated onto a cradle and winched up onto the slipway.They{mend {engines}from the Condor hydrofoils. Last winter one blew up and was rebuilt.The propellers on Condor are changed every 2 or 3 months.The Condor hydrofoils go to Jersey,Alderney and France.
